newsitem.title: TURKEY: End-June dlr/Turk lira seen at 149,000-500 --poll.
newsitem.headline: End-June dlr/Turk lira seen at 149,000-500 --poll.

text.p: Turkish bankers expect the lira to fall to between 149,000 and 149,500 against the dollar at the end of June from 145,900 lira, currently, a Reuters survey of nine banks showed.
Banks also expected dollar/lira to stand between 177,000 and 180,000 at the end of September and between 210,000 and 214,000 at the end of 1997.
But bankers said political uncertainties and currency developments in the international markets could change the pace of lira devaluation against the U.S. currency.
Political uncertainties still dominate Turkish financial markets. Prime Minister Necmettin Erbakan resigned on Wednesday under a plan to hand over power to his coalition partner, Tansu Ciller.
President Suleyman Demirel will meet with opposition leaders before nominating Ciller or another party leader to form the new government.

Earlier this week, the central bank tightened cash liquidity to weaken dollar demand, which has been boosted by political turmoil, in a move bankers said showed that the bank is keen to defend the lira against uncertainties and speculative attacks.
Following is the Reuters poll results of nine banks on June 16-18.
